title: Global employment trends among youth
summary: The good news is the labour market has improved considerably for young people globally since the onset of the Covid-19 pandemic more than four years ago. Last year, 13% of the world’s young labour force – that is, individuals aged 15 to 24 – were unemployed, according to data from the International Labour Organization (ILO). It was the lowest rate in 15 years and a decrease from pre-pandemic times in all but three subregions. In those three subregions – the Arab states, East Asia and Southeast Asia and the Pacific – the youth unemployment rate in 2023 was higher than in 2019. In Southeast Asia and the Pacific (under which Malaysia falls), the unemployment rate grew to 9.9%, from 8.9% in 2019.
content: This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on August 26, 2024 - September 1, 2024

summary: IOI Corp Bhd (KL:IOICORP), Malaysia’s second largest palm oil producer, recorded a ninefold rise in its fourth quarter net profit ended June 30, 2024 (4QFY2024) to RM346.9 million or 5.59 sen per share, from RM37.2 million or 0.60 sen per share a year ago.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 26): IOI Corp Bhd (KL:IOICORP), Malaysia’s second largest palm oil producer, recorded a ninefold rise in its fourth quarter net profit ended June 30, 2024 (4QFY2024) to RM346.9 million or 5.59 sen per share, from RM37.2 million or 0.60 sen per share a year ago.

The earnings growth was boosted by a net foreign currency translation gain of RM24.3 million on foreign currency-denominated borrowings and deposits, compared to a loss of RM171.5 million the previous year.
